basics.name: Brendan Cazier
basics.label: Mechanical Engineer
basics.summary: A mechanical engineer by education, having spent all of my early career fixing physical problems in aircraft maintenance and reliability, but also a hobbyist programmer constantly seeking ways to automate tasks at home. I have worked on both long-term and large-scope campaigns, in addition to high urgency, triage-esque, projects. I enjoy problem solving, and have worked to provide solutions while being conscious of labor difficulties, costs, reliability and regulatory requirements, and more. I am looking to combine my professional engineering experience with my penchant for automation into a career in test automation or DevOps.

courses: CSCI-1190 - Beginning C Programming for Engineers

work.summary: Working in the hangars alongside mechanics to revise errors in technical documentation, providing reinforcing repairs and damage removal instructions. This damage required evaluation, repair development and approval, and documentation, typically within a few hours, to ensure work continued and the Maintenance visits did not exceed scheduled span. Kind of like installing metal bandaids on the outsides of the fuselage.
highlights: Created a catalog app to simplify accessing OEM drawings with varying shapes and dimensions
Addressing corrosion, wear, impact, and other damage with reinforcing doubler/tripler repairs
Maintaining regulatory compliance to 14CFR43, and internal/OEM requirements
Primarily B737-NG and A320F fleets, but also including B777 and B787 mods, as well as B737-MAX deliveries

work.summary: Returning under a project contract to implement a pest control program, and historical maintenance tracking.
highlights: Created a VBA tool to provide B757 lessors with generated reports of Electrical Load and Structural Modification data
Implemented fleetwide (900+ aircraft) pest control program
Tracked component environmental exposure to minimize unnecessary replacement and rework

work.summary: As part of one of the largest airlines globally, AA Tech Ops maintains a number of different aircraft fleets from multiple manufacturers. The fleet group manages aircraft maintenance programs ensuring compliance to FAA regulations and OEM/reliability guidelines. I personally worked with them on and off for three years while in school as a coop and intern among various fleet types.
highlights: Revised technical manuals to improve reliability, save on cost and labor, and incorporate regulatory/OEM requirements.
Developed Nitrogen Generation System safety program to demonstrate airline capability to the FAA
Designed a drop-in air filtration system, prototyped with vendors, and implemented across fleets, in excess of 500 aircraft
Analyzed repeat Maintenance issues to evaluate the possibility of extending the out-of-service check intervals by 50%

projects.name: Jeopardy! Webapp
projects.description: Creating a multiplayer version of the iconic game show with couch-coop or online play.
highlights: The backend is written in Python using Flask to serve pages and Socket.IO for the async bi-directional communication
The frontend uses HTML and CSS for styling, and standard JavaScript for client side events
A separate API to provide game data, as well as developer access to the bank of >400k Jeopardy! questions/answers
API data is stored in a database (currently just SQLite) and interfaced with the SQLAlchemy ORM
